revised_title: A Firsthand Account of a Thunderstorm and Lightning Strike at Sampford-Courtney Church
tldr: The article describes a thunderstorm and lightning strike at Sampford-Courtney Church in Devonshire, England, on October 7th, 1711. The storm caused significant damage to the church, including a large beam being broken, a bell falling, and one of the pinacles being carried away. No one was hurt, and the account comes from the minister who was officiating at the time.
